parameters.name: ERT_DAYS_SINCE_1958
parameters.description: One of the two Earth Receive Time fields.  This component of the ERT contains the Days since January 1st, 1958 starting with 0.  Note there is no accounting for leap seconds in this value.  A day is considered to be a single increment of this field regardless of whether it contains 86400 or 86401 seconds.

parameters.name: ERT_MILLISECONDS
parameters.description: The second Earth Receive Time field.  This component of the ERT contains the milliseconds of the current day.

parameters.name: CRC_CCITT
parameters.description: A CRC calculation over bytes 259 through 384 of this record.  This CRC is generated by the Waves instrument prior to transmitting data to the spacecraft C&DH.  The algorithm for calculating this field (on a little -endian) machine follows. static int              crc_tabccitt_init = 0; static unsigned short   crc_tabccitt[256]; #define                 P_CCITT     0x1021 static void init_crcccitt_tab( void ) { int i, j; unsigned short crc, c; for(i=0; i<256; i++) { crc = 0; c   = ((unsigned short) i) << 8; for(j=0; j<8; j++) { if( (crc ^ c) & 0x8000 ) crc = ( crc << 1 ) ^ P_CCITT; else crc =   crc << 1; c = c << 1; } crc_tabccitt[i] = crc; } crc_tabccitt_init = 1; } /* Calc CRC-CCITT on arbitrary len set of char data */ unsigned short crc_ccitt(const char* sData,size_t szLen) { int i; unsigned short usIdx, usChar, usCRC; sRet[2] = '\0'; if( ! crc_tabccitt_init ) init_crcccitt_tab(); usCRC = 0; for(i = 0; i<szLen; i++){ usChar  = 0x00ff & (unsigned short) sData[i]; usIdx = (usCRC >> 8) ^ usChar; usCRC = (usCRC << 8) ^ crc_tabccitt[usIdx]; } return usCRC; }

parameters.name: TLM_SRC_AND_SEQ
parameters.description: This field defines which software process running within the Waves Instrument CPU generated the data packet.  Values are: 0 - Invalid 1 - High Rate Science Process 2 - Low Rate Science Process 3 - Housekeeping

parameters.name: SCLK_AND_TSF
parameters.description: The seconds portion of the spacecraft clock at which the HSK packet was emitted.  Housekeeping packets are always emitted on an even numbered spacecraft clock, thus the lower bit should always be taken as 0, hence the last bit is used for the Time Quality Flag

parameters.name: MODE_AND_VERSION
parameters.description: This field provides the operating mode of the instrument at the time the packet was generated. These modes are: 0 - Panic mode, ROM Kernel could no be loaded. 1 - ROM, The basic kernel from the instrument ROM is running. 2 - Science, A science program load downloaded from the spacecraft is running. 3 - Diagnostic mode, used only on the bench.

parameters.name: COMMAND_CRC_ERRS
parameters.description: This field holds a count of the number of WAVES command blocks that contained CRC errors.  In other words, the number of CRC verification failures that occurred.

parameters.name: COMMAND_IP_SYNC_ERRS
parameters.description: This field holds a count of the number of CIP records that have an invalid bit pattern.  This covers several type of problem that may occur in the CIP header.

parameters.name: COMMAND_TYPE_ERRS
parameters.description: This field holds a count of the number of CIP records that have a type field that is not handled by the command parser.

parameters.name: COMMAND_UDP_COUNT
parameters.description: Counts the number of command UDP buffers received by the instrument.

parameters.name: COMMAND_CRC_COUNT
parameters.description: This field holds a count of the number of WAVES command blocks.  In other words, the number of CRC verifications that were successful.  Increments for load records as well.

parameters.name: COMMAND_COUNT
parameters.description: This field holds a count of commands received. Variable length commands (such as load records) are not included in this count.

parameters.name: INPUT_IP_PKT_COUNT
parameters.description: This field holds a count of the number of IP packets received.

parameters.name: REF_CLOCKS_MISSED
parameters.description: This field holds a count of the number of reference clocks edges that have been missed.  This is an indication that the external reference clock did not occur when expected.

parameters.name: MISSING_TIME_MSG
parameters.description: This field holds a count of the number of time messages (time at tone) that have not been received.

parameters.name: CLOCK_RESYNC_COUNT
parameters.description: This field holds a count of the number of times the instrument has paused to resynchronize its clock with the spacecraft clock.

parameters.name: LOAD_COUNT
parameters.description: This field is a count of the number of variable length commands (such as load records) that were processed by the instrument.

parameters.name: LOAD_STATUS
parameters.description: 1 - Indicates an bulk memory load is active, 0 - not active

parameters.name: LOAD_RECORD_STATUS
parameters.description: This field holds an instantaneous status for the most recently processed load record.  It may contain on of the following values: 0x00 - Idle 0x01 - Valid_END 0x02 - Valid_LOAD 0x03 - Valid_SKIP 0x04 - Valid_START 0x10 - Valid_MEM_LOAD 0x11 - Valid_BULK_DUMP 0x12 - Valid_COPY 0x13 - Valid CLEAR 0x14 - Valid Compare 0xF8 - Invalid_BULK_DUMP 0xF9 - Invalid_COMPARE 0xFA - Invalid_COPY_Region 0xFB - Invalid_CLEAR_Region 0xFC - Invalid_Sub-type 0xFD - Invalid_Type 0xFE - Invalid_Count 0xFF - Invalid_Sequence

parameters.name: CMD_IP_CHECKSUM_ERR_COUNT
parameters.description: This field in a  count of the number of check sum errors encountered in the IP header of incomming command traffic.

parameters.name: CMD_UDP_CHECKSUM_ERR_COUNT
parameters.description: This field in a count of check sum errors encountered in the UDP header of the incoming command traffic.

parameters.name: SCLK_SUBSEC
parameters.description: The fractional seconds portion of the spacecraft clock from the most recent time tone message.  Each count represents 1/(2^16) of a second.  This value *MUST* be added to all SCLK values, in the science data in order to determine the time of data collection to better than 1 second resolution. The value of this field is added to all relevant SCLKs when generating CODMAC Level 3 data for waves.

parameters.name: HFR_LOCK
parameters.description: HFR lock detect

parameters.name: HFR_LOG_AGC
parameters.description: HFR log detector value used to implement the AGC function within the instrument.  Represents the signal level present on the antenna.

parameters.name: HFR_LOG_SA
parameters.description: Log detector value used to implement the high frequency spectrum analyzer function within the instrument.

parameters.name: WBR_LOCK
parameters.description: WBR lock detect

parameters.name: WBR_LOG_AGC
parameters.description: WBR log detector value used to implement the AGC function within the instrument.  Represents the signal level present on the antenna.

parameters.name: WBR_LOG_SA
parameters.description: Log detector value used to implement the high frequency spectrum analyzer function within the instrument.

parameters.name: WVFE_RUN_PERCENT
parameters.description: Represents how busy the FFT engine processor is. A full scale reading of 100% indicates the processor has no idle time.

parameters.name: WVFE_CORE_VOLTAGE
parameters.description: Processor core voltage for the Waves FFT engine.

parameters.name: MEMORY_VOLTAGE
parameters.description: Instrument main memory voltage

parameters.name: WVFE_LOGIC_VOLTAGE
parameters.description: Connecting logic voltage for the Waves FFT engine.

parameters.name: Y180_CORE_VOLTAGE
parameters.description: Processor core voltage for the Waves main processor.

parameters.name: EXTERNAL_REF_VOLTAGE
parameters.description: Reference 1.5 volt line for the Waves DPU.

parameters.name: Y180_LOGIC_VOLTAGE
parameters.description: Connecting logic voltage for the Waves main processor.

parameters.name: Y180_RUN_PERCENT
parameters.description: Represents how busy the main processor is.  A full scale reading of 100% indicates the processor has no idle time.

parameters.name: IEB_STATUS
parameters.description: This field tells us about the IEB task. When the field is set to all zeros, this indicates that the IEB subsystem is not loaded (so the instrument will not process IEB triggers).

parameters.name: POST_ERRORS
parameters.description: Stores error results from power on self test routines.

parameters.name: UNREG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_5_5V
parameters.description: The voltage on the unregulated +5.5V line to the Waves receiver boards.

parameters.name: UNREG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_NEG_5_5V
parameters.description: The voltage on the unregulated -5.5V line to the Waves receiver boards.

parameters.name: REG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_12V
parameters.description: The voltage on the regulated +12V line to the Waves receiver boards.

parameters.name: REG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_NEG_12V
parameters.description: The voltage on the regulated -12V line to the Waves receiver boards.

parameters.name: UNREG_DPU_LOGIC_SUPPLY_3_6V
parameters.description: The voltage on the unregulated +3.6V line to the connecting logic on Digital Processing Unit board.

parameters.name: UNREG_DPU_CORE_SUPPLY_1_8V
parameters.description: The voltage on the unregulated +1.8V line to the processor core logic on Digital Processing Unit board and to the DPU board A/D converts.  The 1.8V supply is presented directly to the A/D as it is within the range of voltages the A/D can handle.

parameters.name: REG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_15V
parameters.description: The voltage on the regulated +15V line to the Waves receiver boards.

parameters.name: REG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_NEG_15V
parameters.description: The voltage on the regulated -15V line to the Waves receiver boards.

parameters.name: REG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_5V
parameters.description: The voltage on the regulated +5V line to the Waves receiver boards.

parameters.name: REG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_NEG_5V
parameters.description: The voltage on the regulated -5V line to the Waves receiver boards.

parameters.name: REG_2_5V_REFERENCE
parameters.description: 2.5V regulated reference line

parameters.name: UNREG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_13V
parameters.description: The voltage on the unregulated +13V line to the Waves receiver boards.

parameters.name: UNREG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_NEG_13V
parameters.description: The voltage on the unregulated -13V line to the Waves receiver boards.

parameters.name: UNREG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_20V
parameters.description: The voltage on the unregulated +20V line to the Waves receiver boards.  The unregulated +20V supply may range up to around 30 Volts, this is normal and expected.

parameters.name: UNREG_ANALOG_SUPPLY_NEG_20V
parameters.description: The voltage on the unregulated -20V line to the Waves receiver boards.  The unregulated -20V supply may range below -30 Volts, this is normal and expected.

parameters.name: CMD_DEST_ERROR_COUNT
parameters.description: This field holds a count of the number of Waves commands that were received that did not have a queue setup to received the command.  In other words, this is the invalid command index count.

parameters.name: FIRST_MICROPKT_TYPE
parameters.description: Bytes 321 through 336 contain a housekeeping micropacket.  Micropackets provide a path to the ground for low priority and low volume housekeeping data.  This byte defines the micropacket type for the first of four Micropackets delivered in each housekeeping record. Since the micropacket data area is commutated, micropackets cannot be fully described by standard PDS objects.  Only the fields present in all micropackets are defined here. The following housekeeping micropacket types are defined: 0x11 - Clock Status Micropacket 0x12 - Clock Status Micropacket 0xA1 - Waves FFT Engine Status Micropacket 0xB1 - Spectrum Analyzer Status Micropacket 0xC1 - IEB Status Micropacket 0xC2 - IEB Label Micropacket 0xD1 - Power Switch Status Micropacket 0xE0 - Memory Read Out Micropacket 0xE1 - Command Status Error Counters Micropacket 0xE2 - Command Status Buffer Length Error Micropacket 0xF1 - Reset Status Micropacket 0xF2 - ROM Status Micropacket 0xF3 - Hardware Version, Kernel Version Micropacket 0xF4 - Software Build Date Micropacket 0xF5 - Clock Statistics Micropacket 0xF7 - 8-Bit Fast Scan Micropacket 0xF8 - 16-Bit Fast Scan Micropacket See the Waves Users Guide for a full description of micropacket contents.

parameters.name: FIRST_MICROPKT_SEQ
parameters.description: The Sequence field is a monotonically increasing packet counter.  For each micropacket, regardless of type, saved within the instrument, this value increments by 1. Note that the same micropacket may be delivered repeatedly in the housekeeping stream.  This field, along with the TYPE and TIME fields may be used to identify and discard repeated micropackets in the file.

parameters.name: FIRST_MICROPKT_TIME
parameters.description: A combination of the Real Time Interrupt Number and the lower bits of the SCLK_SEC field at the time the micropacket was created.  The two are combined as follows: MICROPKT_TIME = (SCLK_SEC & 0x03FF) + RTI See the Waves User's Guide for information on converting this time to floating point SCLK seconds.

parameters.name: SECOND_MICROPKT_TYPE
parameters.description: Bytes 337 through 352 contain a housekeeping micropacket.  See the description for column FIRST_MICROPKT_TYPE for information on this column.

parameters.name: SECOND_MICROPKT_SEQ
parameters.description: The sequence number for the 2nd micropacket.  See the description for column FIRST_MICROPKT_SEQ for more information

parameters.name: SECOND_MICROPKT_TIME
parameters.description: The time for the 2nd micropacket.  See the description for column FIRST_MICROPKT_TIME for more information.

parameters.name: THIRD_MICROPKT_TYPE
parameters.description: Bytes 353 through 368 contain a housekeeping micropacket. See the description for column FIRST_MICROPKT_TYPE for information on this column.

parameters.name: THIRD_MICROPKT_SEQ
parameters.description: The sequence number for the 3rd micropacket.  See the description for column FIRST_MICROPKT_SEQ for more information

parameters.name: THIRD_MICROPKT_TIME
parameters.description: The time for the 3rd micropacket.  See the description for column FIRST_MICROPKT_TIME for more information.

parameters.name: FOURTH_MICROPKT_TYPE
parameters.description: Bytes 369 through 384 contain a housekeeping micropacket. See the description for column FIRST_MICROPKT_TYPE for information on this column.

parameters.name: FOURTH_MICROPKT_SEQ
parameters.description: The sequence number for the 4th micropacket.  See the description for column FIRST_MICROPKT_SEQ for more information

parameters.name: FOURTH_MICROPKT_TIME
parameters.description: The time for the 4th micropacket.  See the description for column FIRST_MICROPKT_TIME for more information.
